image.altText: A young boy sitting in his dad's lap laughs with his mum, who is sitting by his side smiling at him.

props.synopsis: The mother of a child who featured in a state government autism announcement says she feels "let down" as her son struggles in the school system.Â

title.children: Mum says she feels let down by SA government's autism strategy

image.altText: Man with cap and backpack holds a photo in one hand and a toy in the other in dwilight. Ute with headlights on in background.

props.synopsis: Broken Hill filmmaker Jason King is embarking on his most challenging project yet, telling his story of grief and loss after his daughter's death in the hope of helping others.

title.children: Father who lost 18yo daughter to suicide to honour her through film

image.altText: Mykelti Lefau of the Tigers is attended to by medical staff during the AFL match against the Crows.

props.synopsis: Two teams at opposite ends of the ladder face off as Richmond hosts Adelaide at the MCG. Later on Sunday, Fremantle looks to entrench its position inside the top eight with a clash against St Kilda. Follow live.

title.children: Heartbroken Tiger suffers fresh injury in first game after 393-day absence

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Fremantle - St Kilda is underway at Perth Stadium

image.altText: An image of a dead dolphin at Grange Beach.

props.synopsis: Dolphins, sea lions, sharks, rays and fish have all been sighted washed up dead on Adelaide's beaches as the impact of the algal bloom continues to be felt across the state.

title.children: 'Heartbreaking' algal bloom hits metropolitan Adelaide beaches

image.altText: A collage of two photos, one shows a young man in a suit at a table with a device, the other an older man holding an incubator.

props.synopsis: They developed electric vans and scooters in the 1940s, invented a portable heart monitor and saved thousands of people suffering from polio, so why aren't the Both brothers household names in Australia?

title.children: The Both brothers invented more than 100 devices. Have you heard of them?

image.altText: A man with brown hair smiles, he is wearing a black polo

props.synopsis: Electrician Stuart Campbell was struggling with heartache when a mate dragged him along to a Latin dance club. He loved it so much, he wore out his dancing shoes.

title.children: Tradie's unlikely journey to become a dance instructor

image.altText: Banded stilts in flight near Lake Eyre.

props.synopsis: With Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre expecting its most significant fill in decades, hundreds of thousands of migratory birds are flocking to the inland oasis, but how they know the rare event is happening is an "enduring mystery".

title.children: How birds know when Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre is full remains a mystery

image.altText: A close up selfie of a woman wearing a cap and headphones

props.synopsis: Former reality TV contestant Tamika Chesser, who has been charged with the murder of her partner, has appeared in court. SA Police say they are yet to locate some of the man's remains. Warning: This story contains details some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Beauty and the Geek contestant accused of murder, police search for missing remains

image.altText: Aerial photo of Port Neill Jetty taken by drone on June 26 2025.

props.synopsis: Historic jetties are causing financial headaches for councils as they hand back responsibility for their upkeep to the state government.

title.children: Coastal erosion costs cause uncertain future for beloved SA jetties

image.altText: Close up of a Fuji apple with a barcode sticker

props.synopsis: A South Australian plan to ban non-compostable labels on fresh produce has come unstuck with growers worried about higher costs for consumers during tough times.

title.children: Stickers on fruit might be annoying but there's a reason for them

image.altText: Ilotopie performers coated head to toe in pink photorapher from behind, feat their naked bottoms painted pink

props.synopsis: Thirty years after they were thrown into an Adelaide prison for public nudity, legendary French street artists Ilotopie returned to the scene of the crime â as nude, and as proud, as ever.

title.children: Naked street artists return 30 years after arrests

image.altText: man in suit smiling next to man in sports jacket with grey hair in golf buggy

props.synopsis: Laws that allow the South Australian government to redevelop the North Adelaide Golf Course and move the LIV Golf tournament into the city pass parliament.Â

title.children: Golf redevelopment to go ahead after controversial laws pass SA parliament

image.altText: Minister for Infrastructure and Transport Tom Koutsantonis unveils an advert on new rules around e-scooters

props.synopsis: Private e-scooters and other electronic mobility devices will be allowed on some public roads and footpaths in South Australia from next month, under strict rules.

title.children: Law change allows e-scooters to be used on roads and footpaths in SA

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: A South Australian police officer has been suspended from duty after being arrested and charged with several offences including abuse of public office and stalking.

title.children: SA Police officer arrested and suspended, charged with stalking and assault

image.altText: Two lead smelters side by side in a composite image

props.synopsis: The owner of the Port Pirie and Hobart smelters says its operations will "simply not survive" without taxpayer support to combat alleged market distortion from China.Â

title.children: Port Pirie, Hobart smelters 'cannot be viable' without government help

image.altText: A freight train travels through the outback with mountains in the distance.

props.synopsis: Most "fresh" food travels thousands of kilometres to be sorted, divvied up and, in some cases, sent back to the place it came from â at huge cost to farmers and shoppers. But some new options are starting to sprout.

title.children: The cost of Australia's labyrinthine food distribution system

image.altText: A man holding a caracal

props.synopsis: Under the cover of darkness, and with artillery fire just kilometres away, Marcus Fillinger rescued an emaciated wolf that had been abandoned for weeks in a private zoo in Ukraine.Â

title.children: Why this Aussie drove a sedated wolf through war-torn Ukraine

image.altText: Friday prayers in Tehran

props.synopsis: The news reporting on Iran has encouraged a tendency to see the Iranian state as homogeneous, highly ideological and radically separate from the population.

title.children: Drawing a line between the Iranian state and its people is complicated

image.altText: Jeff Bezos on a boar in black wearing sunglasses as Lauren Sanchez Bezos makes prayer hands

title.children: Bezos wedding sparks more protests on last day of extravaganza

image.altText: A selfie of a man with a beard and blue eyes, standing in front of a white wall.

props.synopsis: Authorities will put "more boots on the ground" in a multi-agency search for Christopher Moore, 38, who failed to return home after a solo camping trip in NSW south coast bushland.

title.children: Search for missing hiker ramps up ahead of forecast wet weather

image.altText: A woman stands in front of apartment buildings.

props.synopsis: Australia's YIMBY movement is relatively new, but it is making an impact and each member has their own housing struggle spurring them on.Â

title.children: The deeply personal reasons Australians call themselves YIMBYs

image.altText: A B-2 Spirit bomber seen against a grey sky.

image.altText: A young couple assist a fuel station attendant to service their car.

props.synopsis: Some independent petrol stations still offer old-fashioned driveway service but it's "very unusual".

image.altText: Mamdani stands below a sign that reads 'afford to live, afford to dream'

props.synopsis: It was a primary race that pitted competing visions for the Democratic Party against one another, and in the end, the New York progressives emerged victorious. They now believe they have the momentum to change their party. Â

title.children: In NYC, a young socialist just defeated the Democratic establishment

image.altText: A close up image of Tony Burke in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Immigration Minister Tony Burke says High Court-ordered revisions have made the preventative detention regime unworkable and he is instead focused on paying countries to take members of the NZYQ migrant cohort.

title.children: Burke concedes preventative detention laws for migrants have failed

image.altText: Police wagon on suburban driveway

props.synopsis: Police have charged a 28-year-old with murder after the "sudden death" of a 44-year-old man at Southport on Saturday night.

image.altText: A group of people stand around an ancient greek temple, dressed in summer clothes one woman holding an umbrella for shade.
